snippet.title: Sadhguru | PRETTY INTENSE PODCAST | Ep. 106
snippet.description:
Sadhguru | PRETTY INTENSE PODCAST | Ep. 106

On the Pretty Intense podcast today is Sadhguru who is a pretty intensely spiritual man. Sadhguru is a renowned speaker,  a best-selling author, and founder of the Isha Foundation, whose mission is to raise human consciousness through individual transformation, focusing on human empowerment and social revitalization. For any of you out there doing some spiritual diving, you no doubt have come across Sadhguru. This was a true honor to speak to him. His wisdom is wide and deep, and he‚Äôs also very playful and fun. He has a real true understanding of the human experience, and how to essentially escape karma. This is what we talked about most. How memory affects us, and ways to make peace with it. Leaving that bag of Karma behind, to allow ourselves a more joyful life. Make sure to grab his new book " Karma - A Yogi's guide to crafting your destiny."

====

Sadhguru is a yogi, mystic and visionary. Named one of India‚Äôs 50 most influential people, Sadhguru‚Äôs work has touched the lives of millions worldwide through his transformational programs. Sadhguru has a unique ability to make the ancient yogic sciences relevant to contemporary minds. His approach does not ascribe to any belief system, but offers methods for self-transformation that are both proven and powerful.
An internationally renowned speaker and author  of the New York Times Bestsellers Inner 
Engineering, A Yogi‚Äôs Guide to Joy, and Karma, A Yogi‚Äôs Guide to Crafting Your Destiny, Sadhguru has been an influential voice at major global forums including the United Nations and the World Economic Forum, addressing issues as diverse as socioeconomic development, leadership and spirituality. He has also been invited to speak at leading educational institutions, including Oxford, London Business School, IMD, Stanford, Harvard, Yale, Wharton and MIT. In February 2017, Sadhguru was the recipient of the Padma Vibhushan Award by the Government of India, the highest annual civilian award, accorded for exceptional and distinguished service.
Dedicated to the physical, mental and spiritual wellbeing of humanity and gifted with utter clarity of perception, Sadhguru possesses a perspective on life that never fails to intrigue, challenge and surprise all those he encounters.

snippet.title: A mind blowing talk by Sadhguru - How to change the course of our life ?
snippet.description:
We often ten to meet and greet people around us .
And we enjoy their company but sometimes we do regret the same decision.
But have you ever thought what is going wrong with you or your life ?
It's time to understand and change the things forever and turn around the situation around you and yourself for the better.
In this video Sadhguru will explain how staying alone can change one's way of looking at situations in life when one understands that good or misery he or she itself  is responsible .
Once there is this awakening within you ; there will be no issues and you will navigate through life effortlessly.

snippet.title: Sadhguru | PRETTY INTENSE PODCAST | Ep. 106
snippet.description:
Sadhguru | PRETTY INTENSE PODCAST | Ep. 106

On the Pretty Intense podcast today is Sadhguru who is a pretty intensely spiritual man. Sadhguru is a renowned speaker,  a best-selling author, and founder of the Isha Foundation, whose mission is to raise human consciousness through individual transformation, focusing on human empowerment and social revitalization. For any of you out there doing some spiritual diving, you no doubt have come across Sadhguru. This was a true honor to speak to him. His wisdom is wide and deep, and he‚Äôs also very playful and fun. He has a real true understanding of the human experience, and how to essentially escape karma. This is what we talked about most. How memory affects us, and ways to make peace with it. Leaving that bag of Karma behind, to allow ourselves a more joyful life. Make sure to grab his new book " Karma - A Yogi's guide to crafting your destiny."

====

Sadhguru is a yogi, mystic and visionary. Named one of India‚Äôs 50 most influential people, Sadhguru‚Äôs work has touched the lives of millions worldwide through his transformational programs. Sadhguru has a unique ability to make the ancient yogic sciences relevant to contemporary minds. His approach does not ascribe to any belief system, but offers methods for self-transformation that are both proven and powerful.
An internationally renowned speaker and author  of the New York Times Bestsellers Inner 
Engineering, A Yogi‚Äôs Guide to Joy, and Karma, A Yogi‚Äôs Guide to Crafting Your Destiny, Sadhguru has been an influential voice at major global forums including the United Nations and the World Economic Forum, addressing issues as diverse as socioeconomic development, leadership and spirituality. He has also been invited to speak at leading educational institutions, including Oxford, London Business School, IMD, Stanford, Harvard, Yale, Wharton and MIT. In February 2017, Sadhguru was the recipient of the Padma Vibhushan Award by the Government of India, the highest annual civilian award, accorded for exceptional and distinguished service.
Dedicated to the physical, mental and spiritual wellbeing of humanity and gifted with utter clarity of perception, Sadhguru possesses a perspective on life that never fails to intrigue, challenge and surprise all those he encounters.

snippet.title: Sadhguru | PRETTY INTENSE PODCAST | Ep. 106
snippet.description:
Sadhguru | PRETTY INTENSE PODCAST | Ep. 106

On the Pretty Intense podcast today is Sadhguru who is a pretty intensely spiritual man. Sadhguru is a renowned speaker,  a best-selling author, and founder of the Isha Foundation, whose mission is to raise human consciousness through individual transformation, focusing on human empowerment and social revitalization. For any of you out there doing some spiritual diving, you no doubt have come across Sadhguru. This was a true honor to speak to him. His wisdom is wide and deep, and he‚Äôs also very playful and fun. He has a real true understanding of the human experience, and how to essentially escape karma. This is what we talked about most. How memory affects us, and ways to make peace with it. Leaving that bag of Karma behind, to allow ourselves a more joyful life. Make sure to grab his new book " Karma - A Yogi's guide to crafting your destiny."

====

Sadhguru is a yogi, mystic and visionary. Named one of India‚Äôs 50 most influential people, Sadhguru‚Äôs work has touched the lives of millions worldwide through his transformational programs. Sadhguru has a unique ability to make the ancient yogic sciences relevant to contemporary minds. His approach does not ascribe to any belief system, but offers methods for self-transformation that are both proven and powerful.
An internationally renowned speaker and author  of the New York Times Bestsellers Inner 
Engineering, A Yogi‚Äôs Guide to Joy, and Karma, A Yogi‚Äôs Guide to Crafting Your Destiny, Sadhguru has been an influential voice at major global forums including the United Nations and the World Economic Forum, addressing issues as diverse as socioeconomic development, leadership and spirituality. He has also been invited to speak at leading educational institutions, including Oxford, London Business School, IMD, Stanford, Harvard, Yale, Wharton and MIT. In February 2017, Sadhguru was the recipient of the Padma Vibhushan Award by the Government of India, the highest annual civilian award, accorded for exceptional and distinguished service.
Dedicated to the physical, mental and spiritual wellbeing of humanity and gifted with utter clarity of perception, Sadhguru possesses a perspective on life that never fails to intrigue, challenge and surprise all those he encounters.

snippet.title: Sadhguru at Columbia University, New York - Youth and Truth, Apr 29, 2019 [Full Talk]
snippet.description:
On 29 April, 2019, Sadhguru was at Columbia University, New York as part of the Youth and Truth movement. Watch the vibrant QnA session that followed as Sadhguru answered students‚Äô questions on a wide range of topics. #YouthAndTruth #UnplugWithSadhguru #NewYork

00:00 Session Starts
01:24 How do we find purpose in this world ?
08:59 How do I keep track of most important thing (my family) in life ?
19:41 How can we bring people together in such a divided world ?
27:42 As business leaders, what role can we play to unite this world ?
35:48 How do you see religion being more torelant towards LGBTQ community ?
39:27 What's your favorite recipe and please explain more about yogic diet ?
54:19 Why are people increasingly dependent on drugs to solve their problems ?
59:48 How do you reconcile conflict between your goals/principles and what you love ?
1:01:08 How do you work towards your passions without losing sight of your goal ?
1:09:59 Why so much disparity between child in africa and US. And who are we in this cosmos ?
1:22:37 How can we as more privileged people help the less privileged people ?
1:30:22 What advice do you give to someone who has healing powers and can help people ?
1:36:38 If we detach from our biological identity, where do I start if I want to help ?

snippet.title: Sadhguru | PRETTY INTENSE PODCAST | Ep. 106
snippet.description:
Sadhguru | PRETTY INTENSE PODCAST | Ep. 106

On the Pretty Intense podcast today is Sadhguru who is a pretty intensely spiritual man. Sadhguru is a renowned speaker,  a best-selling author, and founder of the Isha Foundation, whose mission is to raise human consciousness through individual transformation, focusing on human empowerment and social revitalization. For any of you out there doing some spiritual diving, you no doubt have come across Sadhguru. This was a true honor to speak to him. His wisdom is wide and deep, and he‚Äôs also very playful and fun. He has a real true understanding of the human experience, and how to essentially escape karma. This is what we talked about most. How memory affects us, and ways to make peace with it. Leaving that bag of Karma behind, to allow ourselves a more joyful life. Make sure to grab his new book " Karma - A Yogi's guide to crafting your destiny."

====

Sadhguru is a yogi, mystic and visionary. Named one of India‚Äôs 50 most influential people, Sadhguru‚Äôs work has touched the lives of millions worldwide through his transformational programs. Sadhguru has a unique ability to make the ancient yogic sciences relevant to contemporary minds. His approach does not ascribe to any belief system, but offers methods for self-transformation that are both proven and powerful.
An internationally renowned speaker and author  of the New York Times Bestsellers Inner 
Engineering, A Yogi‚Äôs Guide to Joy, and Karma, A Yogi‚Äôs Guide to Crafting Your Destiny, Sadhguru has been an influential voice at major global forums including the United Nations and the World Economic Forum, addressing issues as diverse as socioeconomic development, leadership and spirituality. He has also been invited to speak at leading educational institutions, including Oxford, London Business School, IMD, Stanford, Harvard, Yale, Wharton and MIT. In February 2017, Sadhguru was the recipient of the Padma Vibhushan Award by the Government of India, the highest annual civilian award, accorded for exceptional and distinguished service.
Dedicated to the physical, mental and spiritual wellbeing of humanity and gifted with utter clarity of perception, Sadhguru possesses a perspective on life that never fails to intrigue, challenge and surprise all those he encounters.

snippet.title: Sadhguru | PRETTY INTENSE PODCAST | Ep. 106
snippet.description:
Sadhguru | PRETTY INTENSE PODCAST | Ep. 106

On the Pretty Intense podcast today is Sadhguru who is a pretty intensely spiritual man. Sadhguru is a renowned speaker,  a best-selling author, and founder of the Isha Foundation, whose mission is to raise human consciousness through individual transformation, focusing on human empowerment and social revitalization. For any of you out there doing some spiritual diving, you no doubt have come across Sadhguru. This was a true honor to speak to him. His wisdom is wide and deep, and he‚Äôs also very playful and fun. He has a real true understanding of the human experience, and how to essentially escape karma. This is what we talked about most. How memory affects us, and ways to make peace with it. Leaving that bag of Karma behind, to allow ourselves a more joyful life. Make sure to grab his new book " Karma - A Yogi's guide to crafting your destiny."

====

Sadhguru is a yogi, mystic and visionary. Named one of India‚Äôs 50 most influential people, Sadhguru‚Äôs work has touched the lives of millions worldwide through his transformational programs. Sadhguru has a unique ability to make the ancient yogic sciences relevant to contemporary minds. His approach does not ascribe to any belief system, but offers methods for self-transformation that are both proven and powerful.
An internationally renowned speaker and author  of the New York Times Bestsellers Inner 
Engineering, A Yogi‚Äôs Guide to Joy, and Karma, A Yogi‚Äôs Guide to Crafting Your Destiny, Sadhguru has been an influential voice at major global forums including the United Nations and the World Economic Forum, addressing issues as diverse as socioeconomic development, leadership and spirituality. He has also been invited to speak at leading educational institutions, including Oxford, London Business School, IMD, Stanford, Harvard, Yale, Wharton and MIT. In February 2017, Sadhguru was the recipient of the Padma Vibhushan Award by the Government of India, the highest annual civilian award, accorded for exceptional and distinguished service.
Dedicated to the physical, mental and spiritual wellbeing of humanity and gifted with utter clarity of perception, Sadhguru possesses a perspective on life that never fails to intrigue, challenge and surprise all those he encounters.

snippet.title: Sadhguru | PRETTY INTENSE PODCAST | Ep. 106
snippet.description:
Sadhguru | PRETTY INTENSE PODCAST | Ep. 106

On the Pretty Intense podcast today is Sadhguru who is a pretty intensely spiritual man. Sadhguru is a renowned speaker,  a best-selling author, and founder of the Isha Foundation, whose mission is to raise human consciousness through individual transformation, focusing on human empowerment and social revitalization. For any of you out there doing some spiritual diving, you no doubt have come across Sadhguru. This was a true honor to speak to him. His wisdom is wide and deep, and he‚Äôs also very playful and fun. He has a real true understanding of the human experience, and how to essentially escape karma. This is what we talked about most. How memory affects us, and ways to make peace with it. Leaving that bag of Karma behind, to allow ourselves a more joyful life. Make sure to grab his new book " Karma - A Yogi's guide to crafting your destiny."

====

Sadhguru is a yogi, mystic and visionary. Named one of India‚Äôs 50 most influential people, Sadhguru‚Äôs work has touched the lives of millions worldwide through his transformational programs. Sadhguru has a unique ability to make the ancient yogic sciences relevant to contemporary minds. His approach does not ascribe to any belief system, but offers methods for self-transformation that are both proven and powerful.
An internationally renowned speaker and author  of the New York Times Bestsellers Inner 
Engineering, A Yogi‚Äôs Guide to Joy, and Karma, A Yogi‚Äôs Guide to Crafting Your Destiny, Sadhguru has been an influential voice at major global forums including the United Nations and the World Economic Forum, addressing issues as diverse as socioeconomic development, leadership and spirituality. He has also been invited to speak at leading educational institutions, including Oxford, London Business School, IMD, Stanford, Harvard, Yale, Wharton and MIT. In February 2017, Sadhguru was the recipient of the Padma Vibhushan Award by the Government of India, the highest annual civilian award, accorded for exceptional and distinguished service.
Dedicated to the physical, mental and spiritual wellbeing of humanity and gifted with utter clarity of perception, Sadhguru possesses a perspective on life that never fails to intrigue, challenge and surprise all those he encounters.

snippet.title: Sadhguru | PRETTY INTENSE PODCAST | Ep. 106
snippet.description:
Sadhguru | PRETTY INTENSE PODCAST | Ep. 106

On the Pretty Intense podcast today is Sadhguru who is a pretty intensely spiritual man. Sadhguru is a renowned speaker,  a best-selling author, and founder of the Isha Foundation, whose mission is to raise human consciousness through individual transformation, focusing on human empowerment and social revitalization. For any of you out there doing some spiritual diving, you no doubt have come across Sadhguru. This was a true honor to speak to him. His wisdom is wide and deep, and he‚Äôs also very playful and fun. He has a real true understanding of the human experience, and how to essentially escape karma. This is what we talked about most. How memory affects us, and ways to make peace with it. Leaving that bag of Karma behind, to allow ourselves a more joyful life. Make sure to grab his new book " Karma - A Yogi's guide to crafting your destiny."

====

Sadhguru is a yogi, mystic and visionary. Named one of India‚Äôs 50 most influential people, Sadhguru‚Äôs work has touched the lives of millions worldwide through his transformational programs. Sadhguru has a unique ability to make the ancient yogic sciences relevant to contemporary minds. His approach does not ascribe to any belief system, but offers methods for self-transformation that are both proven and powerful.
An internationally renowned speaker and author  of the New York Times Bestsellers Inner 
Engineering, A Yogi‚Äôs Guide to Joy, and Karma, A Yogi‚Äôs Guide to Crafting Your Destiny, Sadhguru has been an influential voice at major global forums including the United Nations and the World Economic Forum, addressing issues as diverse as socioeconomic development, leadership and spirituality. He has also been invited to speak at leading educational institutions, including Oxford, London Business School, IMD, Stanford, Harvard, Yale, Wharton and MIT. In February 2017, Sadhguru was the recipient of the Padma Vibhushan Award by the Government of India, the highest annual civilian award, accorded for exceptional and distinguished service.
Dedicated to the physical, mental and spiritual wellbeing of humanity and gifted with utter clarity of perception, Sadhguru possesses a perspective on life that never fails to intrigue, challenge and surprise all those he encounters.

snippet.title: Sadhguru | PRETTY INTENSE PODCAST | Ep. 106
snippet.description:
Sadhguru | PRETTY INTENSE PODCAST | Ep. 106

On the Pretty Intense podcast today is Sadhguru who is a pretty intensely spiritual man. Sadhguru is a renowned speaker,  a best-selling author, and founder of the Isha Foundation, whose mission is to raise human consciousness through individual transformation, focusing on human empowerment and social revitalization. For any of you out there doing some spiritual diving, you no doubt have come across Sadhguru. This was a true honor to speak to him. His wisdom is wide and deep, and he‚Äôs also very playful and fun. He has a real true understanding of the human experience, and how to essentially escape karma. This is what we talked about most. How memory affects us, and ways to make peace with it. Leaving that bag of Karma behind, to allow ourselves a more joyful life. Make sure to grab his new book " Karma - A Yogi's guide to crafting your destiny."

====

Sadhguru is a yogi, mystic and visionary. Named one of India‚Äôs 50 most influential people, Sadhguru‚Äôs work has touched the lives of millions worldwide through his transformational programs. Sadhguru has a unique ability to make the ancient yogic sciences relevant to contemporary minds. His approach does not ascribe to any belief system, but offers methods for self-transformation that are both proven and powerful.
An internationally renowned speaker and author  of the New York Times Bestsellers Inner 
Engineering, A Yogi‚Äôs Guide to Joy, and Karma, A Yogi‚Äôs Guide to Crafting Your Destiny, Sadhguru has been an influential voice at major global forums including the United Nations and the World Economic Forum, addressing issues as diverse as socioeconomic development, leadership and spirituality. He has also been invited to speak at leading educational institutions, including Oxford, London Business School, IMD, Stanford, Harvard, Yale, Wharton and MIT. In February 2017, Sadhguru was the recipient of the Padma Vibhushan Award by the Government of India, the highest annual civilian award, accorded for exceptional and distinguished service.
Dedicated to the physical, mental and spiritual wellbeing of humanity and gifted with utter clarity of perception, Sadhguru possesses a perspective on life that never fails to intrigue, challenge and surprise all those he encounters.

snippet.title: Sadhguru | PRETTY INTENSE PODCAST | Ep. 106
snippet.description:
Sadhguru | PRETTY INTENSE PODCAST | Ep. 106

On the Pretty Intense podcast today is Sadhguru who is a pretty intensely spiritual man. Sadhguru is a renowned speaker,  a best-selling author, and founder of the Isha Foundation, whose mission is to raise human consciousness through individual transformation, focusing on human empowerment and social revitalization. For any of you out there doing some spiritual diving, you no doubt have come across Sadhguru. This was a true honor to speak to him. His wisdom is wide and deep, and he‚Äôs also very playful and fun. He has a real true understanding of the human experience, and how to essentially escape karma. This is what we talked about most. How memory affects us, and ways to make peace with it. Leaving that bag of Karma behind, to allow ourselves a more joyful life. Make sure to grab his new book " Karma - A Yogi's guide to crafting your destiny."

====

Sadhguru is a yogi, mystic and visionary. Named one of India‚Äôs 50 most influential people, Sadhguru‚Äôs work has touched the lives of millions worldwide through his transformational programs. Sadhguru has a unique ability to make the ancient yogic sciences relevant to contemporary minds. His approach does not ascribe to any belief system, but offers methods for self-transformation that are both proven and powerful.
An internationally renowned speaker and author  of the New York Times Bestsellers Inner 
Engineering, A Yogi‚Äôs Guide to Joy, and Karma, A Yogi‚Äôs Guide to Crafting Your Destiny, Sadhguru has been an influential voice at major global forums including the United Nations and the World Economic Forum, addressing issues as diverse as socioeconomic development, leadership and spirituality. He has also been invited to speak at leading educational institutions, including Oxford, London Business School, IMD, Stanford, Harvard, Yale, Wharton and MIT. In February 2017, Sadhguru was the recipient of the Padma Vibhushan Award by the Government of India, the highest annual civilian award, accorded for exceptional and distinguished service.
Dedicated to the physical, mental and spiritual wellbeing of humanity and gifted with utter clarity of perception, Sadhguru possesses a perspective on life that never fails to intrigue, challenge and surprise all those he encounters.
